Articles.Content:
So I have an ultra realistic version of 1.3.1 KSP with 61 mods installed, including RSS, Ven's Part Revamp and RealFuels but not RO. I built a Mars lander with a Terrier engine in the Aerozine50-NTO configuration and found out the engine was being repelled from the planet because, when I scaled it down, the mass went from 0.2 tons to -0.115 tons, and so the engine floats away. It also happens with other parts such as some nuclear engines which go as low as 4 tons negative mass. I don't know how to fix this. The original file for the Terrier did nothing when I tried to change its mass, nor did the Ven's Part Revamp one and I'm too scared to touch the TweakScale one. Is there anything I can do to fix this? This is my list of mods. Any help is appreciated!


000_AT_Utils - 1.5
USI Tools - 0.10.2
ToolbarControl - 0.1.4.7
Ablative-Airbrake - 0.3
AlmostFreeLaunchClamps - 0.2.2

[MOD - This question regarding personal tweaks/fixes to a modded install has been moved to the Add-on Discussions subforum]
Tweakscale causes most negative mass issues.

1 hour ago, RoboRay said:

Tweakscale causes most negative mass issues.

I deleted the previous post, as I had misunderstood the problem. 

@mankeez, please post your KSP.log file in this issue. This can help to to trim down the possibilities.

https://github.com/net-lisias-ksp/TweakScale/issues/11

By the way - absolutely fantastic bug report, you enumerated the mods and the versions. Thank you.

 

Edited December 4, 2018 by Lisias
problem was misunderstood. fixing the post
